data.scheme_name: Maharashtra New Information Technology and Information Technology Enabled Services (IT/ITES) Policy, 2023 - Promotion of Tt & ITeS Infrastructure – IT Townships and IT Parks - Development Incentives - Premium for additional Floor Space index for IT Park - New
data.benefits: This scheme provides benefit of upto 100% exemption for premium of additional FSI
data.eligibility: IT & ITES units in the state.
data.beneficiaries: IT & ITES units in the state.
data.context: This policy is introduced to make Maharashtra a global IT &ITES destination and the Technology capital of India, moving towards innovative, equitable, inclusive and sustainable Technology Development.
data.objective: To ensure Maharashtra as the most preferred destination for investment and innovation among global IT&ITES enterprises through Strategic Policy Interventions, Development of Competitive Advantage and Enabling Business Environment.
data.description:
1. For Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation Area: - all Public and Private Information Technology Parks/AVGC Parks, in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation area; Additional FSI shall be admissible by levying a premium at the rate of 50 % of prevailing rate of premium to be charged for the area as mentioned in the respective DCPRs. 
2. For the Rest of Maharashtra: - 
(a) Areas in Vidharbha, Marathwada, Dhule, Nandurbar, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg, no premium will be charged for additional Floor Space Index (FSI). 
(b) the additional FSI shall be permissible to all Public & Private IT Parks / AVGC Parks by levying a premium at the rate of 50 % of prevailing rate of premium for areas other than mentioned above 
3. For Central Business District: - all registered public and private Information Technology parks/ AVGC parks; in the particular CBD’s will be entitled for permissible additional FSI by levying a premium at the rate of 50 % of the existing rate of premium as mentioned in the DCPR of Central Business District
data.how_to_apply:
1. Users can register on the website: www.di.maharashtra.gov.in for availing services. 
  2. A soft copy of the documents (PAN Card ) must be uploaded during the registration process. (Please note that system will only allow uploading of documents in PDF format with a maximum size of 5 MB.) 
  3. On successful registration the user will receive an activation pin code by email and SMS at their registered email address and mobile number. 
  4. This code is used to validate user registration to complete the registration process.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.highlights: Investor's Guide Directorate of Industries, Government of Maharashtra
data.faq: Investor's Guide Directorate of Industries, Government of Maharashtra
data.additional_info: If an Existing Unit, makes on or after commencement of this Policy, minimum 25% additional fixed capital investment in IT &ITES/AVGC activity, then such project will be considered as Expansion/ Diversification Project.
data.checklist_info_a:
Udyam Registration Certificate 
GST Certificate 
Financials for Last 2 years 
Projected financial data 
Lending Bank Details 
Basic KYC Documents 
Online submission of report on 2% Incubation Space in an IT Park by a developer
Online Submission of Six-Monthly Report
Detailed Project Report
data.checklist_info_d:
Address : Directorate of Industries, New Administrative Building,
2nd Floor, Madame Cama Road,
Opp. Mantralaya, Mumbai – 400032
Email: didci[at]maharashtra[dot]gov[dot]in
Phone: (022) 22028100
Fax: (022) 22026826
data.beneficiary: Specific Service Industries - All Entities - Maharashtra - All MSMEs and Non MSMEs
